translation: You have the right to perform your duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions. - Bhagavad Gita 2.47
meaning: Focus on your actions without attachment to results.
translation_hindi: आपके पास अपने कर्तव्यों को निभाने का अधिकार है, लेकिन आप अपने कार्यों के फलों के अधिकारी नहीं हैं। - भगवद गीता 2.47

translation: Perform your obligatory duty, because action is indeed better than inaction. - Bhagavad Gita 3.8
meaning: It’s better to act than to sit idle.
translation_hindi: अपने अनिवार्य कर्तव्यों का पालन करें, क्योंकि कार्य निष्क्रियता से बेहतर है। - भगवद गीता 3.8

translation: The mind acts like an enemy for those who do not control it. - Bhagavad Gita 6.6
meaning: Control your mind or it will control you.

translation: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase in unrighteousness, O Arjuna, at that time I manifest myself. - Bhagavad Gita 4.7
meaning: God incarnates whenever needed to protect dharma.

translation: A person can rise through the efforts of his own mind; or draw himself down, in the same manner. Because each person is his own friend or enemy. - Bhagavad Gita 6.5
meaning: Your progress depends on your own self-effort.

translation: Among all kinds of killers, time is the ultimate because time kills everything. - Bhagavad Gita 10.30

meaning: Fearlessness is the first divine quality.

translation: Those who are motivated only by desire for the fruits of action are miserable, for they are constantly anxious about the results of what they do. - Bhagavad Gita 2.49
You have the right to work (karma) but never to the fruit of work. - Bhagavad Gita 2.47
meaning: Focus on your duty, not the results.
